channel.title: Cli on drasyl provides secure, software-defined overlay networks, connecting all your devices
channel.description: Recent content in Cli on drasyl provides secure, software-defined overlay networks, connecting all your devices

item.title: drasyl 0.8.0 released with improved Hole Punching, Remote Controlling for CLI, and increased TUN Device performance
item.description: Today, we are excited to announce the release of drasyl 0.8.0 with improved hole punching protocol, remote controlling via JSON-RPC for node and tun CLI commands, and increased TUN device performance.

item.title: drasyl 0.7.0 released with TUN Device Support and Faster UDP Hole Punching
item.description: Today, we are excited to announce the release of drasyl 0.7.0 with TUN device support, faster UDP hole punching, IP broadcast-based peer discovery, and identity generation utility.

item.title: drasyl 0.6.0 released with Support for Netty Handlers, Backpressure Mechanism, and Tunnel Utility
item.description: Today, we are excited to announce the release of drasyl 0.6.0 with support for Netty channel handlers, backpressure mechanism, option to disable data plane encryption, file transfer for wormhole utility, and port tunneling utility.

item.title: For our Windows User(s): Install drasyl CLI via Chocolatey
item.description:
Following our last year’s announcement of bringing drasyl to Homebrew for Linux and macOS users, we’re now bringing drasyl to Chocolatey.

Chocolatey is “The Package Manager for Windows”. Therefore, it provides a very comfortable way to install/update the drasyl CLI for our Windows users.

item.title: drasyl 0.4.0 released with UDP Hole Punching, Message Chunking, and Bandwidth Measurement Utility
item.description: Today, we are excited to announce the release of drasyl 0.4.0 with UPD hole punching, message chunking, in-process discovery, static routes, and network bandwidth measurement utility.

item.title: Install drasyl CLI via Homebrew
item.description: Homebrew is “The Missing Package Manager for macOS (or Linux)”. Therefore, it provides a very comfortable way to install/update the drasyl CLI.

item.title: drasyl 0.2.0 released with Plugin Support, Message Marshaling, and a Wormhole!
item.description: Today, we are excited to announce the release of drasyl 0.2.0 with plugin support, message marshaling, port forwarding, a filesystem-based peer discovery, and an ominous wormhole ðŸ•³ï¸.

item.title: Run drasyl CLI through Docker
item.description: The drasyl CLI can now be used within a Docker Container. To do so, we’ve uploaded the current release on Docker Hub.
